===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょう}} {{m|ltc|笙|tr={{IPAchar|/*shræng/}}}}. [[呉音#Japanese|Goon]], so likely the original reading as first borrowed from {{etyl|ltc|-}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|笙|tr=shēng}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|しょう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょう|hhira=しゃう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょう|musical instrument}} the [[sho]]
#: A free-[[reed]] [[woodwind]] [[musical]] [[instrument]] consisting of a [[mouthpiece]] and seventeen [[pipe]]s, each similar to an [[w:Organ pipe|organ pipe]]. Developed from the Chinese ''[[shēng]]'' that was introduced to Japan during the [[w:Nara period|Nara Period]]. Traditionally used to provide [[accompaniment]] in [[雅楽#Japanese|''gagaku'']] (traditional Japanese court music), and now also used in some [[contemporary]] music.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|鳳管|ほうかん}}

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|笙の笛|しょう の ふえ}}: a type of [[simplified]] sho used as a [[toy]]
* {{ja-r|笙歌|しょうか}}, {{ja-r|笙歌|せいか}}: [[singing]] to a sho [[accompaniment]]; to [[sing]] to a sho accompaniment; a [[song]] [[sung]] to a sho accompaniment
* {{ja-r|笙岩屋|^しょう の ^いわや}}, {{ja-r|笙窟|^しょう の ^いわや}}: a [[cave]] and [[pilgrimage]] [[destination]] in central [[w:Nara Prefecture|Nara Prefecture]]
* {{ja-r|鳳笙|ほうしょう}}: [[sho]]
* {{ja-r|蘆笙|ろしょう}}

=====See also=====
* {{pedialite|Gagaku}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|そう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょう}} {{m|ltc|笙}}. [[漢音#Japanese|Kan'on]], so likely an historically later reading. Compare modern {{cog|yue|笙|tr=saang¹, sang¹}}. Seen in ''[[w:The Tale of Genji|The Tale of Genji]]''.

This reading is obsolete in modern Japanese.
